bibliographic-data.invention-title: System and Method for Linked Account Having Sweep Feature

nplcit.text: Deposit operations by David Friedman published by Amrrican Bankers Association 1992 Pages 147-149

abstract.p: A linked account instrument is used to access funds in an existing demand deposit account held at a financial institution. Merchant or other transactions are first processed against a demand deposit account via an electronic authorization network. If the demand deposit account does not have sufficient funds, the transactions may be processed as a credit charge against an designated credit account. The demand deposit account may subsequently be swept at predetermined times in search of funds to defray the overdraft. If adequate funds are present, they will be withdrawn from the demand deposit account, and the credit account will be cleared. Otherwise, the instrument holder's daily purchasing abilities may be temporarily suspended until the credit account is settled. The processing of overdraft amounts may be on a FIFO, smallest-first or other basis.

abstract.p: A linked account instrument is used to access funds in an existing demand deposit account held at a financial institution. Merchant or other transactions are first processed against a demand deposit account via an electronic authorization network. If the demand deposit account does not have sufficient funds, the transactions may be processed as a credit charge against a designated credit account. The demand deposit account may subsequently be swept at predetermined times in search of funds to defray the overdraft. If adequate funds are present, they will be withdrawn from the demand deposit account, and the credit account will be cleared. Otherwise, the instrument holder's daily purchasing abilities may be temporarily suspended until the credit account is settled. The processing of overdraft amounts may be on a FIFO, smallest-first or other basis.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR LINKED ACCOUNT HAVING SWEEP FEATURE

abstract.p: A computer-implemented method for facilitating electronic funds transactions is disclosed. According to one embodiment, the method may comprise the steps of: issuing a transaction card to a cardholder by associating the transaction card with a demand deposit account from which the cardholder is authorized to electronically disburse funds

receiving an authorization request for an attempted transaction between a merchant and the cardholder, the authorization request containing information associated with the transaction card and the attempted transaction
processing the authorization request based on one or more predetermined business rules
authorizing the transaction without immediately settling the transaction against the demand deposit account of the cardholder
and settling the transaction, at a time subsequent to the execution of the transaction, through automated clearing house (ACH) from funds retained within the demand deposit account of the cardholder.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR LINKED ACCOUNT HAVING SWEEP FEATURE
SYSTEME ET PROCEDE POUR COMPTE LIE A DES DISPONIBILITES AVEC FONCTION DE RECHERCHE DE TRESORERIE

abstract.p: A linked account instruments is used to access funds in an existing demand deposit account held at a financial institution. Merchant or other transactions (110) are first processed against a demand deposit account (160) via an electronic authorization network (130). If the demand deposit account (160) does not have sufficient funds, the transactions may be processed as a credit charge against an designated credit account (140). The demand deposit account (160) may subsequently be swept at predetermined times in search of funds to defray the overdraft. If adequate funds are present, they will be withdrawn from the demand deposit account, and the credit account will be cleared. Otherwise, the instrument holder's daily purchasing abilities may be temporarily suspended until the credit account is settled. The processing of overdraft amounts may be on a FIFO, smallest-first or other basis.

Cette invention se rapporte à un instrument de compte lié à des disponibilités, qui est utilisé pour accéder à des fonds enregistrés dans un compte de dépôt à vue existant détenu auprès d'une institution financière. Les transactions auprès de marchands ou autres (110) sont d'abord traitées par rapport à un compte de dépôt à vue (160) via un réseau d'autorisation électronique (130). Si le compte de dépôt à vue (160) ne dispose pas de fonds suffisants, la transaction peut être traitée sous la forme d'une dépense à crédit par rapport à un compte de crédit désigné (140). Le compte de dépôt à vue (160) peut ensuite faire l'objet d'une recherche de trésorerie à des moments prédéterminés, les fonds ainsi recherchés devant venir compenser le découvert.

Si des fonds appropriés sont présents, ils vont être prélevés du compte de dépôt à vue et le compte de débit est alors ramené à zéro. Sinon, les capacités d'achat quotidiennes du détenteur de l'instrument financier peuvent être temporairement suspendues, jusqu'à ce que le compte de crédit soit réglé. Le traitement du découvert peut se faire sur une base "premier entré premier sorti", "le plus petit en premier" ou autre.
